page.title: 10KING'S NEWNHAM III
page.content:
Housing & Buildings
Most of the houses in these villages are privately owned, though a small factor are council properties. Some of the occupants live in farm houses, an example of which is Manor House and Farm. This farm covers 197.060 acres. This is made up of arable land, pasture and a dairy.The property in question has Farm, River, Brick and Thatched Buildings. The Manor House itself contains many rooms and extensive lawn gardens. Adjacent to this 17th century property is a magnificent old church which is surrounded by a large graveyard. The population of the two villages have the opportunity to attend a weekly service in this ancient building.
